isis.stitle: 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS FULLER RT-610 SERIES - LUBRICATION

svcproc.title: Service Procedure
svcproc.para: Eaton Fuller Transmissions are designed so that the internal parts operate in a bath of oil circulated by the motion of gears and shafts.
Thus, all parts will be amply lubricated if these procedures are closely followed:

step1.para: Use the correct grade and type of oil. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

svcproc.para: The use of mild EP gear oil or multi- purpose gear oil is not recommended, but if these gear oils are used, be sure to adhere to the following limitations:

Do not use mild EP gear oil or multi-pur- pose gear oil when operating temperatures are above 230°F (110°C). Many of these gear oils, particularly 85W140, break down above 230°F and coat seals, bearings and gears with deposits that may cause premature failures. If these deposits are observed (especially a coating on seal areas causing oil leakage), change to Eaton Roadranger CD50 transmission fluid, heavy duty engine oil or mineral gear oil to assure maximum component life and to maintain your warranty with Eaton.

In addition, transmission oil coolers are not recommended with these gear oils since the oil cooler materials may be attacked by these gear oils. The lower temperature limit and oil cooler restriction with these gear oils generally limit their success to milder applications.
Additives and friction modifiers are not recommended for use in Eaton Fuller transmissions.
